intro: Rondeletia crassinervis, commonly known as the broad-veined rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with prominent veins, giving it the species name "crassinervis." It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories.
